News.Title: InterGlobe Aviation Block Trade Worth Rs. 48.69 Crores
News.Summary: InterGlobe Aviation executed a significant NSE block trade involving 100,129 shares at Rs. 4863.00 per share, totaling Rs. 48.69 crores in transaction value.

News.Title: CCI Orders Investigation Into IndiGo Flight Cancellations
News.Summary: Competition Commission of India initiates investigation into IndiGo airline following flight cancellations that occurred in December, examining potential competition law violations.

News.Title: IndiGo Cuts Delhi-Manchester Flight Frequency
News.Summary: IndiGo announces reduction in Delhi-Manchester route operations from daily to 4 times weekly starting February 7, with further cuts to 3 times weekly from February 19.

News.Title: IndiGo Plans Flexible Network Adjustments
News.Summary: IndiGo announces strategy to monitor external changes and adapt its flight network operations flexibly based on evolving market conditions and operational requirements.

News.Title: Fuel Price Drop Benefits Airlines Including IndiGo
News.Summary: Aviation fuel prices decline for second consecutive month, offering cost relief to airlines like IndiGo after extended period of elevated fuel expenses impacting operations.

News.Title: IndiGo Cancels Flights to 4 Cities Till Feb 11
News.Summary: IndiGo suspended flights to Tbilisi, Almaty, Baku and Tashkent till February 11 due to escalating tensions around Iran, prioritizing passenger and crew safety amid regional security concerns.

News.Title: IndiGo launches Mumbai-Athens direct flights
News.Summary: IndiGo becomes first Indian carrier to operate direct flights between India and Greece, launching Mumbai-Athens route with Airbus A321XLR aircraft. Delhi-Athens service to begin January 24, 2026.

News.Title: InterGlobe Aviation Defers FY27 Growth Guidance
News.Summary: InterGlobe Aviation management states it's premature to provide FY2027 projections as summer schedule planning and CASK refinements remain incomplete during recent conference call.

News.Title: IndiGo Q3 profit plunges 78% to ₹549 crore amid disruptions
News.Summary: India's largest airline reports weakest performance in four years due to exceptional costs of ₹1,546.5 crore from new labour codes and December flight cancellations. Company scales back growth outlook.

News.Title: IndiGo to surrender unused airport slots amid reset
News.Summary: IndiGo will return unutilised airport slots following DGCA's 10% flight schedule cut order after December operational disruptions that affected 300,000 passengers with 4,500 cancellations.

News.Title: IndiGo CFO Reveals $10 Billion USD Exposure
News.Summary: IndiGo's Chief Financial Officer disclosed the airline's significant foreign exchange exposure of nearly $10 billion to the US Dollar, highlighting the company's substantial international financial commitments.

News.Title: IndiGo Co-CEO Expects No More Aviation Fines
News.Summary: IndiGo's Co-CEO expresses confidence that the airline will not face additional penalties from India's aviation regulator, signaling potential resolution of regulatory concerns.

News.Title: IndiGo CFO: More Leased Aircraft Needed for Operations
News.Summary: IndiGo's CFO highlights the need for additional leased aircraft as ongoing Pratt & Whitney engine groundings continue to impact the airline's fleet availability and operational capacity.

News.Title: IndiGo CFO Forecasts Cost Rise, Revenue Dip Ahead
News.Summary: IndiGo's CFO projects mid-single digit unit cost increase for FY26 excluding forex and fuel, while anticipating early to mid-single digit unit revenue decline in Q4.

News.Title: IndiGo Plans Business Cabin Expansion to 65 Aircraft
News.Summary: IndiGo's Co-CEO announces strategic expansion of business cabin services across 65 aircraft, marking significant growth in premium segment offerings for India's largest airline.

News.Title: IndiGo Plans 10% Capacity Growth in Q4 FY25
News.Summary: InterGlobe Aviation's IndiGo announces expected capacity expansion of approximately 10% for Q4 FY25 compared to the same quarter in the previous fiscal year, indicating continued growth trajectory.

News.Title: IndiGo Reports Q3 Load Factor of 84.6%
News.Summary: IndiGo achieves 84.6% load factor in Q3 with available seat kilometers reaching 45.4 billion and yield of ₹5.33 per kilometer, demonstrating strong operational performance.

News.Title: Delhi HC seeks IndiGo affidavit on Dec flight chaos
News.Summary: Delhi High Court directs IndiGo to file affidavit on refunds and compensation for passengers affected by December flight disruptions. DGCA imposed ₹22.2 crore penalty on airline for operational lapses.

News.Title: Government to Seek IndiGo VP Dismissal Over Flight Chaos
News.Summary: Indian government announces it will ask Delhi court to direct IndiGo to dismiss a vice-president following flight disruption incidents that caused significant passenger inconvenience.

News.Title: IndiGo faces regulatory scrutiny amid market dominance
News.Summary: IndiGo pledges compliance with pilot fatigue norms by February 10 after DGCA fine of ₹22.3 crore. Aviation sector's duopoly raises antitrust concerns with limited new entrants.

News.Title: Govt Plans to Remove Airfare Cap: IndiGo Impact
News.Summary: Government reportedly considering removal of airfare caps, potentially impacting airline pricing strategies and market dynamics for carriers like IndiGo.

News.Title: Government May Remove Cap on IndiGo Operations
News.Summary: Reports suggest the government is considering removing operational caps imposed on IndiGo, India's largest airline by market share, potentially allowing expanded operations.

News.Title: IndiGo Q3 earnings preview: Flight chaos impact
News.Summary: IndiGo faces investor scrutiny as Q3 earnings approach following December flight cancellations. Analysts expect one of the airline's worst quarters with 25% Ebitdar decline and ₹830 crore disruption costs.

News.Title: IndiGo Faces ₹22 Cr Penalty Over Pilot Shortage Issues
News.Summary: DGCA imposes ₹22 crore penalty on IndiGo for December operational chaos, while industry experts question airline's ability to meet pilot hiring commitments amid staffing challenges.

News.Title: IndiGo shares surge 5% as Jefferies raises target
News.Summary: InterGlobe Aviation shares jumped 5% after Jefferies raised price target to ₹6,140 with 'Buy' rating, following DGCA's ₹22.20 crore fine for December disruptions. Focus shifts to schedule normalisation.

News.Title: IndiGo Board Commits to Fix December 2025 Issues
News.Summary: InterGlobe Aviation acknowledges DGCA orders on December 2025 disruptions, with board promising systemic reforms and improved internal procedures following ₹22.20 crore penalty.

News.Title: DGCA Confirms IndiGo Refunds Fully Processed
News.Summary: Aviation regulator announces complete processing of refunds for IndiGo flight cancellations during December 3-5 disruptions. Airline offers additional ₹10,000 travel vouchers as gesture of care for affected passengers.

News.Title: IndiGo Cancels 3 International Flights Due to Iran Airspace Closure
News.Summary: IndiGo cancelled three international flights on January 16 due to Iranian airspace closure amid US-Iran tensions. Air India's A350 also faced ground incident at Delhi airport with engine damage.

News.Title: IndiGo Launches 'Sail into 2026' Sale Starting ₹1,499
News.Summary: IndiGo announces special fare sale with domestic flights from ₹1,499 and international from ₹4,499. Booking open January 13-16, 2026 for travel until April 30, 2026 across multiple routes.

News.Title: IndiGo launches New Year sale with fares from ₹1,499
News.Summary: IndiGo announces 'Sail Into 2026' New Year sale offering domestic fares starting at ₹1,499 and international fares from ₹4,499. Sale valid for bookings from January 13-16 for travel between January 20 and April 30, 2026.

News.Title: InterGlobe Aviation Block Trade Worth ₹36.16 Crores
News.Summary: InterGlobe Aviation witnessed a significant NSE block trade of ₹36.16 crores involving approximately 75,650 shares at ₹4,780 per share, indicating substantial institutional activity.

News.Title: IndiGo leads Airbus deliveries globally for 2nd year
News.Summary: IndiGo received 55 Airbus aircraft in 2025, representing 6.93% of total deliveries and maintaining its position as the largest single recipient of Airbus planes globally for the second consecutive year.

News.Title: Kotak Cuts IndiGo Target Price to ₹5,300 on Crude Concerns
News.Summary: Kotak Institutional Equities reduces IndiGo's target price from ₹5,350 to ₹5,300 citing crude oil and currency assumption changes, while maintaining 'add' rating despite regulatory scrutiny concerns.

News.Title: DGCA Upholds ₹40L Penalty on IndiGo Executives
News.Summary: DGCA appellate authority rejects IndiGo's appeal, confirming ₹20 lakh penalty each on two senior executives for unqualified pilot training simulators at Category C airports.

News.Title: DGCA Reinstates ₹2 Million Fine on IndiGo Directors
News.Summary: DGCA Appellate Authority rejects IndiGo's appeal and reinstates ₹2 million penalty on directors for improper simulator use in pilot training programs.

News.Title: IndiGo receives first Airbus A321 XLR aircraft
News.Summary: IndiGo becomes first Indian carrier to induct A321 XLR, deploying it for Athens flights. Aircraft features 8,700 km range with 195 seats in dual-class configuration.

News.Title: AAIB Recommends DGCA Inspect Airlines' Safety Systems
News.Summary: Aircraft Accident Investigation Bureau recommends DGCA inspection of airlines' safety management systems following airprox incident involving two IndiGo flights in Delhi airspace on November 17, 2023.

News.Title: CCI Probes IndiGo for Unfair Business Practices
News.Summary: Competition Commission seeks information from IndiGo and DGCA to assess potential anti-competitive practices following December flight cancellations that disrupted operations.

News.Title: DGCA Seeks Airline Fare Data After December Flight Chaos
News.Summary: DGCA mandates IndiGo, Air India, SpiceJet, and Akasa to provide average fare data following December disruptions when IndiGo cancelled 4,500 flights, causing fare surges and prompting government intervention.

News.Title: IndiGo Set To Induct India's First Airbus A321 XLR
News.Summary: IndiGo becomes first Indian airline to induct Airbus A321 XLR, with aircraft landing Wednesday after 3 PM. Plans second A321 XLR by FY end for Delhi-Mumbai-Athens routes.

News.Title: InterGlobe Aviation Block Trade Worth ₹16.24 Crores
News.Summary: InterGlobe Aviation witnessed a significant NSE block trade of ₹16.24 crores involving 32,680 shares at ₹4,968.00 per share, indicating institutional investor activity.

News.Title: InterGlobe Aviation Block Trade Worth ₹15.42 Crores
News.Summary: InterGlobe Aviation witnessed a significant block trade on NSE involving 30,620 shares at ₹5,035.00 per share, totaling ₹15.42 crores in transaction value.

News.Title: IndiGo Confirms All Securities in Demat Form for Q3
News.Summary: InterGlobe Aviation reports 100% dematerialization of securities with no rematerialization requests received during quarter ended December 31, 2025, meeting SEBI compliance requirements.

News.Title: IndiGo completes one year in Puducherry operations
News.Summary: IndiGo marks one year of operations in Puducherry with 14 weekly flights connecting Bengaluru and Hyderabad, enhancing regional connectivity for healthcare, education and tourism.

News.Title: IndiGo Launches ₹10,000 Compensation for Flight Delays
News.Summary: IndiGo introduces 'Gesture of Care' offering ₹10,000 vouchers to passengers affected by December 3-5 flight disruptions. Compensation available via vouchers or bank transfer.

News.Title: IndiGo Plans Athens Flights with A321XLR from Jan 2026
News.Summary: IndiGo announces non-stop flights to Athens starting January 23, 2026, using India's first Airbus A321XLR aircraft to expand medium-to-long-haul connectivity options.

News.Title: IndiGo Reflects on 2025 Progress and Global Expansion
News.Summary: InterGlobe Aviation's IndiGo welcomed over 123 million customers in 2025, launched long-haul services to Europe, expanded to 139 destinations, and doubled A350 aircraft orders to 60 units.

News.Title: IndiGo CEO Outlines Global Expansion Strategy for 2025
News.Summary: IndiGo advances its global airline strategy with 10 new international destinations, 30 new routes, and expects over 12.3 crore customers by year-end. CEO Pieter Elbers highlights network expansion despite operational challenges.

News.Title: IndiGo Opens Applications for A320 Captains & Officers
News.Summary: IndiGo launches recruitment drive for experienced Airbus A320 pilots, seeking Captains and Senior First Officers with valid ATPL licenses to comply with new FDTL norms and maintain operations.

News.Title: Aviation Ministry Reviews IndiGo Disruption Report
News.Summary: Civil Aviation Ministry analyzes probe panel report on IndiGo's massive flight disruptions from December, which led to over 1,600 flight cancellations and regulatory action including 10% schedule reduction.
